      • build

        public FailoverPolicy build()
        Builds a new policy by copying all configuration options from this builder.
        Returns:
        New failover policy.

      • getErrorTypes

        public List<Class<? extends Throwable>> getErrorTypes()
        Returns the list of error types that can be supported by a failover policy (see setErrorTypes(List)).
        Returns:
        LIst of error types.

      • setErrorTypes

        public void setErrorTypes(List<Class<? extends Throwable>> errorTypes)
        Sets the list of error types that can be supported by a failover policy.

        If none of the specified types matches with a failure then failover policy is to fail.

        If error types are not specified then failover policy will be applied to all error types.

        Parameters:
        errorTypes - Error types.

      • withErrorTypes

        public FailoverPolicyBuilder withErrorTypes(Class<? extends Throwable> errorType)
        Fluent-style version of setErrorTypes(List).
        Parameters:
        errorType - Error type.
        Returns:
        This instance.

      • getRetryDelay

        public FailoverDelaySupplier getRetryDelay()
        Returns the retry delay supplier (see setRetryDelay(FailoverDelaySupplier)).
        Returns:
        Supplier of retry delay value.

      • setRetryDelay

        public void setRetryDelay(FailoverDelaySupplier retryDelay)
        Sets the retry delay supplier. This supplier will be used by a failover policy to get a retry delay value for the FailureResolution.withDelay(long) method.
        Parameters:
        retryDelay - Delay supplier.

      • withRetryDelay

        public FailoverPolicyBuilder withRetryDelay(FailoverDelaySupplier retryDelay)
        Fluent-style version of setRetryDelay(FailoverDelaySupplier).
        Parameters:
        retryDelay - Delay supplier.
        Returns:
        This instance.

      • withConstantRetryDelay

        public FailoverPolicyBuilder withConstantRetryDelay(long delay)
        Shortcut method to apply ConstantFailoverDelay to this builder.
        Parameters:

        This instance.

      • getRetryUntil

        public List<FailoverCondition> getRetryUntil()
        Returns the list of failover conditions (see setRetryUntil(List)).
        Returns:
        List of failover conditions.

      • setRetryUntil

        public void setRetryUntil(List<FailoverCondition> retryUntil)
        Sets the list of failover conditions that should be checked by a failover policy before trying to apply failover actions.

        All conditions are checked one by one and if at least one of them returns false then failover actions will not be applied and operation will fail.

        If failover conditions are not specified then failover policy will always fail.

        Parameters:
        retryUntil - Failover conditions.

      • withRetryUntil

        public FailoverPolicyBuilder withRetryUntil(FailoverCondition retryUntil)
        Fluent style version of setRetryUntil(List).
        Parameters:
        retryUntil - Failover conditions.
        Returns:
        This instance.

      • withMaxAttempts

        public FailoverPolicyBuilder withMaxAttempts(int attempts)
        Shortcut method to setRetryUntil(List) register} a MaxFailoverAttempts condition to this builder.
        Parameters:
        attempts - Maximum number of attempts (see MaxFailoverAttempts.MaxFailoverAttempts(int)).
        Returns:
        This instance.

      • getRoutingPolicy

        public FailoverRoutingPolicy getRoutingPolicy()

        Returns:
        Routing policy.
